tag: html body text title span span
content: UDA Home Design Idea Workshop - Zoned Heating and Air Conditioning

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td b font font span
content: Zoned Heating and Cooling Systems

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: From the first blast of winter throughthe dog days of summer, it is a domestic power struggle more fierce thanthe competition for the television remote control. When one thermostatcontrols the temperature for an entire house, it produces predictable resultsthat pit husband against wife and basement playroom against upstairs officein "

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font b span
content: The Battle of the Thermostat

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: Thewar begins when dad turns the thermostat down because the family room istoo warm. A few minutes later mom turns up the thermostat because the bedroomis too cold. Eventually, someone is opening a window or closing a ventto get the temperature just right, and no one is really comfortable. Butthere's a better solution than family feuds or dressing in layers.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font b span
content: Zoned heating and cooling systemsallow you to control the temperature of each room individually.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: Byusing a series of motorized dampers and thermostats that work independently,zoning can eliminate hot or cold rooms found in almost every home, whilecutting energy by up to 25 percent, according to Anne Drake, a spokeswomanfor Honeywell's zone control systems.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td ul font font span
html body text center table tbody tr td ul font font b span
content: People like to save energy

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td ul font font span
content: ,but they don't like to sacrifice comfort," said Drake. "Energy savingsused to be the key thing in people's minds when it came to air conditioningand heating, now

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td ul font font b span
content: comfort is also a major consideration

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td ul font font span
content: . When yousit down and explain to people what zoning does from a cost efficiencystandpoint, you are basically them comfort in their home."

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td font font span
content: Simplelaws of physics illustrate why it is virtually

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td font font b span
content: impossible to keep anentire house at a consistent temperature

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td font font span
content: without zoning. Warm air riseswhile cold air sinks, leaving upstairs rooms six to ten degrees warmerand basements six to ten degrees cooler than ground level rooms. A singlethermostat keeps the temperature balanced in the room where it is located,but can't tell if the temperature has changed in other rooms of the house.Zoning helps maintain a consistent temperature throughout the house byproviding different levels of air distribution to different areas of thehome.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font b span
content: Zone controlled systems divide ahome into areas with common heating and cooling needs during specific partsof the day.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: Air flow is controlled in each area by a separate thermostat.Instead of sending the same amount of heated or cooled air into all roomevery time the furnace or air conditioner is turned on, the system sendsconditioned air only to the zones that need it. Temperaturs can be keptat an ideal comfort level when the family is up and about, then changedto an energy-saving temperature overnight or when the family is away.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: For example, in a typical two-storyhouse, the main floor with the living room, kitchen and dining area, isusually occupied during the evenings. Bedrooms are occupied mostly at nightand in the early morning.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font b span
content: With zoning, you can cool or heat one areaof the house at a time.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: You can also select different temperature settingsfor each zone of the house. In most homes, a two or three zone system issufficient. Rarely does a home equire more than three zones.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: Most homes can be zoned

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font b span
content: accordingto room occupancy

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: , but unique exposure factors may require a differentzoning strategy. A room with large amounts of glass facing south or westwill have more heat gain than other rooms in the home. A separate zonemight be required for that room alone!

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: At an average price of $1,200, zonecontrol systems provide a cost efficient alternative to dual air systemsthat require separate air conditioners and furnaces for different areasof the house, according to Ron Reinhardt of Research Products Corporation."It justs makes sense. You become more comfortable in your home, and yousave money."

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font b span
content: Zone control is especially effectivein homes that have multiple levels, spawling designs, large glass windows,or large open areas such as an atrium or solarium

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: . Existing homes withfinished basements, attic spaces and additions are also good candidatesfor zoning. Almost all forced air systems can be converted for zone control,according to Reinhardt. "A control panel, thermostats, dampers and theproper duct work are all it takes."

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td p font font span
content: Builders are still learning about zonecontrol systems, even though HVAC contractors have been installing themfor the last five years or more. Zoning is still be introduced in someregions of the United States and has been well received by the home-buyingpublic.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td ul font font span
content: "Almost every time I sat down to writecontract with a home buyer, the first thing they wanted added to theirhome was zone heating and air conditioning," said Dennis Belk, a divisionmanager for Dobson Builders in Greenville, South Carolina. Dobson has madezoned controlled heating and air a standard feature in homes priced over$120,000.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td font font span
content: While still in it's infancy, zoning isto heating and cooling what the light switch is to lighting. Virtuallyall homes come equipped with more than one light switch, and one day soon,homes may come with more than one thermostat.

tag: html body text center table tbody tr td center i font font span
content: Sharon Ray is a freelance writerbased in Atlanta, Ga.
